name: Ace
description: Paracetamol is indicated for fever, common cold and influenza, headache, toothache, earache, bodyache etc.
dosage: Adult: 1-2 tablets every 4 to 6 hours up to a maximum of 4 gm (8 tablets) daily. and Children (6-12 years): ½ to 1 tablet 3 to 4 times daily. For long term treatment it is wise not to exceed the dose beyond 2.6 gm/day.

name: Sergel
description: Esomeprazole is indicated to relieve from chronic heartburn symptoms and other symptoms associated with GERD.
dosage: 20 mg or 40 mg Once Daily for 4-8 Weeks. The majority of patients are healed within 4 to 8 weeks. For patients who don't heal after 4-8 weeks, an additional 4-8 weeks of treatment may be considered. Maintenance of Healing of Erosive

name: Cal-Coral-D
description: This is indicated for the treatment & prevention of osteoporosis, osteomalacia, tetany, hypoparathyroidism, disorders of osteogenesis.
dosage: One tablet once or twice daily with plenty of water or as directed by the physician. Taking in full stomach ensures better absorption.

name: Dimerol
description: Gliclazide is a medicine that reduces blood sugar levels (oral antidiabetic medicine belonging to the sulphonylurea group).
dosage: Film-coated tablet: The usual initial dose is 40 to 80 mg daily. The dose can be increased up to 320 mg daily in divided doses when needed.The drug should be taken before meal. For children, Gliclazide is not used because it is contraindicated in juvenile-onset diabetes.

name: Tusca
description: This is indicated for the symptomatic relief of upper respiratory tract disorders accompanied by productive cough.
dosage: Adult and Children over 12 years: 10 ml (2 teaspoonful) three times a day. Children 6-12 years: 5 ml (1 teaspoonful) three times a day.

name: Seclo
description: Omeprazole is indicated for the treatment of- Gastric and duodenal ulcer.
dosage: 20 mg once daily for 4 weeks in duodenal ulceration, 8 weeks in gastric ulceration.

name: Pevisone
description: Econazole Nitrate & Triamcinolone Acetonide indicated for the treatment of: Eczematous Mycoses Psoriasis.
dosage: This cream should be applied sparingly to the skin lesion no more than 2 times daily, preferably once in the morning and once in the evening.

name: MaxPro
description: Esomeprazole is indicated to relieve from chronic heartburn symptoms and other symptoms associated with GERD.
dosage: 20 mg or 40 mg Once Daily for 4-8 Weeks. The majority of patients are healed within 4 to 8 weeks.

name: Monas
description: Omeprazole is indicated for the treatment of- Gastric and duodenal ulcer.
dosage: Adults & adolescents (15 years & older)- 10 mg/day and Pediatric patients (6 to 14 years)- 5 mg/day.

name: Napa
description: Paracetamol is indicated for fever, common cold and influenza, headache, toothache etc.
dosage: Adult: 1-2 tablets every 4 to 6 hours up to a maximum of 4 gm (8 tablets) daily. and Children (6-12 years): ½ to 1 tablet 3 to 4 times daily.
